meta.title: Home, Greenwich Public Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: A K-12 public school district dedicated to excellence

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Home, Greenwich Public Schools, A K-12 public school district dedicated to excellence
A K-12 public school district dedicated to excellence

meta.name: google-site-verification

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2 district

div.p: A K-12 public school district dedicated to excellence

div.div: SCHOOLS OF EXCELLENCE The Greenwich Public Schools (GPS) consist of eleven elementary schools, three middle schools, and one high school with an alternative high school program. Four of the elementary schools (Hamilton Avenue School, International School at Dundee, Julian Curtiss School, and New Lebanon School) are magnet schools, as is Western Middle School.

Strategic Plan 2015-2020 The Greenwich Public Schools 2015-2020 Strategic Plan is designed to achieve academic, personal and interpersonal growth by providing personalized learning opportunities for each student.

PERSONALIZED LEARNING With a focus on Personalized Learning using traditional and digital tools and resources, the Greenwich Public Schools presents a standards-based curriculum through research -based instructional and assessment practices.
GPS Central Office The GPS Cabinet and related offices are housed at the Central Office, located at 290 Greenwich Avenue. Central Office business hours are Monday-Friday, 8:00am-4:30pm.
Board of Education Meeting News Next scheduled Board of Education Meeting: Thursday, April 23, 2020 -- 7:00 PM Start Time

li.a: School Start (Bell) Time Ad Hoc Committee

div.div: Community Web Calendar Explore the GPS Community Web Calendar for youth and family-oriented activities, programs and events provided by our local not-for-profit community organizations.
Greenwich Public School Events Click on a link to the left for school-specific event calendars.

section.class: fsElement fsNavigation fsList navigation main main-mobile

li.a: Hamilton Avenue School Field Improvement Project
Meal Prices, Menus, Payment Procedures & Refunds
School Start (Bell) Time Ad Hoc Committee

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow news-list fsItemCount_6 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailLarge

img.alt: Greenwich High School Senior Awarded Equitable Excellence Scholarship

div.a: Greenwich High School Senior Awarded Equitable Excellence Scholarship

div.p: Greenwich High School Senior Melissa Woo was recently awarded a $2,500 Equitable Excellence Scholarship for her work creating a mobile application, "Under My Wing," that promotes protection from sexual harassment and assault for women.

article.a: Read more about Greenwich High School Senior Awarded Equitable Excellence Scholarship

img.alt: GHS "We the People" Program Wins Multiple National Accolades

div.a: GHS "We the People" Program Wins Multiple National Accolades

div.p: Greenwich High School's We The People section of Advanced Placement U.S. Government and Advanced Placement Comparative Politics has amassed a number of national accolades.

article.a: Read more about GHS "We the People" Program Wins Multiple National Accolades

img.alt: 10 GHS Students Win Awards for Connecticut History Day Contest

div.a: 10 GHS Students Win Awards for Connecticut History Day Contest

div.p: The Connecticut History Day Committee recently announced the 2020 Fairfield Regional Contest Results. Among the winners were ten GHS students, representing seven different project winners.

article.a: Read more about 10 GHS Students Win Awards for Connecticut History Day Contest

img.alt: GHS Model United Nations Club Receives Record Honors at Harvard Model UN Conference

div.a: GHS Model United Nations Club Receives Record Honors at Harvard Model UN Conference

div.p: Last weekend, at the Sixty-Seventh Session of Harvard Model United Nations Conference, 17 GHS students were recognized for their performance, representing the most successful showing the school's club has had at this event.

article.a: Read more about GHS Model United Nations Club Receives Record Honors at Harvard Model UN Conference

img.alt: 2018-2019 NGAI Results Released; Six "Schools of Distinction" Identified

div.a: 2018-2019 NGAI Results Released; Six "Schools of Distinction" Identified

div.p: The State of Connecticut's Department of Education recently released the results from the latest Next Generation Accountability Index (NGAI) for the 2018-2019 school year.

article.a: Read more about 2018-2019 NGAI Results Released; Six "Schools of Distinction" Identified

img.alt: Eight GHS Seniors Eligible for U.S. Presidential Scholars Program

div.a: Eight GHS Seniors Eligible for U.S. Presidential Scholars Program

div.p: Eight Greenwich High School seniors have been identified as candidates for the United States Presidential Scholars Program and are eligible to apply to become semifinalists.

article.a: Read more about Eight GHS Seniors Eligible for U.S. Presidential Scholars Program
